sentences.cn: “这里热死了，”米里亚姆抱怨道。

sentences.en: A cut-out stops the kettle boiling dry.
sentences.cn: 断流装置避免水壶烧干。

sentences.en: Can I open a window? It’s boiling in here.
sentences.cn: 我开扇窗好吗？这里热死人了。

sentences.en: For him, the place is fairly boiling with humanity.
sentences.cn: 对他来说，这个地方充满了人情味。

sentences.en: Hearing the news, we the class are boiling.
sentences.cn: 一听到这个消息，我们全班都沸腾了。

sentences.en: Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together.
sentences.cn: 将大黄和甘菊一起煮沸再用文火炖，熬成汤药。

sentences.en: Mal's temper was at boiling point.
sentences.cn: 马尔正在气头上，一点就着。

sentences.en: Place the saucepan over moderate heat until the cider is very hot but not boiling.
sentences.cn: 把炖锅置于中火上加热，直到苹果酒变得很烫，但不要加热到沸腾。

sentences.en: Pour a kettle of boiling water over the onions.
Racial tension has reached boiling point .
sentences.cn: 种族间的紧张状态已达到一触即发的程度。

sentences.en: The boiling point of water is 373 K.
The ground had opened to disgorge a boiling stream of molten lava.
sentences.cn: 大地开裂，汩汩冒出炽热的熔岩。

sentences.en: The pan overflowed with boiling milk.
sentences.cn: 煮沸的牛奶溢出了奶锅。

sentences.en: The temperature gauge indicated that it was boiling.
The water was bubbling and boiling away.
sentences.cn: 水在咕嘟咕嘟地沸腾着。

sentences.en: Water can be purified by boiling for five minutes.
sentences.cn: 水煮沸5分钟便可得到净化。

sentences.en: When everybody else is boiling hot, I'm freezing!
sentences.cn: 当其他所有人都酷热难耐时，我却冻得够呛！

sentences.en: You must be boiling in that sweater!
sentences.cn: 你穿着那件毛衣一定很热！

words.tran_cn: 煮（boil的过去式和过去分词）
煮沸，烧开；使…激动；使…蒸发

trans.tran_cn: 炎热的，炽热的，沸腾的，激昂的
